conclusion: Set-up of the geometry with outer radius R, inner radius r = R/2, incident angle i = 45°, and identification of rays a, b, c.
Refraction angle of green light is determined to be 30° using the condition that the ray is tangent to the inner surface.
Refractive index of the material for green light is calculated as √2 using Snell's law.
Ordering of refractive indices is determined: n_a > n_b > n_c, leading to speed order v_a < v_b < v_c.
Normal optical dispersion gives n violet > n green > n red.
Identification of colors: ray a = violet, ray b = green, ray c = red.
The light with the smallest speed in the material is violet (ray a).
